effects: The lair warps reality; surfaces become uneven and passages shift subtly, making navigation difficult.
Creatures within the lair have disadvantage on initiative rolls due to the disorienting environment.
Small vermin and aberrant creatures proliferate in the tunnels surrounding the lair.
The ambient temperature drops noticeably within the lair, and a faint aura of dread pervades the area.
Undead within 1 mile of the lair have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.
Creatures that take a short rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit from the rest due to disturbing visions.

naturalHazards.name: Cave-In
naturalHazards.description: Unstable ceilings can collapse when disturbed by loud noises, explosions, or certain spells. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d10 bludgeoning damage on a failure and half as much on a success. Failed saves also result in being buried under rubble (Restrained, requiring a DC 20 Strength check to escape).

naturalHazards.name: Flooding
naturalHazards.description: Underground water sources can flood chambers and passages. Rising water fills a room at a rate of 1 foot per round. Creatures caught in flooded passages may need to swim (Athletics check against current DC) or risk drowning.

naturalHazards.name: Bad Air
naturalHazards.description: Some dungeon areas contain pockets of toxic or depleted air. A creature that enters a bad air zone must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be Poisoned for 1 hour. In areas with no breathable air, creatures begin suffocating.

naturalHazards.name: Slippery Surfaces
naturalHazards.description: Water, slime, or ice makes dungeon floors treacherous. Affected areas are difficult terrain, and a creature that moves more than half its speed in the area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check or fall Prone.
